empyrean.conflictDescription: Still a success, but with a drawback of some kind (such as taking damage or losing a resource). If you’re affecting a track, this usually still lets you mark or clear a box.
empyrean.disasterDescription: A failure that also introduces a narrative complication or drawback of some kind. If you’re affecting a track, this usually doesn’t let you mark or clear at all.
empyrean.name: Name
empyrean.track_update: Click: Update Marks, Shift/Ctrl Click: Update Burn
empyrean.triumphDescription: A complete success with no drawbacks. If you’re affecting a track, this lets you mark or clear 3 boxes.
empyrean.flareDescription: There is a Flare in the Empyreal Flame. Any effected Dynamic Pools must roll for Flux
empyrean.userNotFound: You don't have an Actor assigned.
empyrean.userNotPermitted: You can only roll for actors you own

TOOLTIPS.grace: An edge of elegance, precision, & agility
TOOLTIPS.iron: An edge of force, determination, & willpower
TOOLTIPS.instinct: An edge of sense, intuition, & reaction
TOOLTIPS.reason: An edge of logic, wit, & planning
TOOLTIPS.fury: An edge of savagery, passion, & destruction
TOOLTIPS.litany: An edge of learning, lore, & memory
TOOLTIPS.veils: An edge of shadows, ciphers, & secrecy
TOOLTIPS.radiance: An edge of charisma, inspiration, and leadership
TOOLTIPS.study: Discover, record, interpret, decipher, determine patterns and flaws.
TOOLTIPS.twist: Turn something on its head, particularly Void or Beacon power usage.
TOOLTIPS.husken: A basic and guttural language mainly used to give simple orders to Husks.
TOOLTIPS.battleVox: Language used by The Legions for tactical and guarded communications.
TOOLTIPS.lantic: A sonorous and beautiful language used by Beacons
TOOLTIPS.abythalyss: Dark, harsh, yet strangely sibilant and seductive language used by those who serve THE DARKNESS.
TOOLTIPS.highAuric: The overly formal and complicated language of The Guild. Used in official and ceremonial ways.
TOOLTIPS.glosyr: Indesipherable coded language of The Inquisition.
TOOLTIPS.glyphic: A non-spoken language used for signalling and often used on controls.
TOOLTIPS.gant: Gant is the language of the common worker. Blunt and to the point, it was born of rebellion against The Guild.
TOOLTIPS.auribond: Used by The Legions in their hymns, battle songs, and inspirational writings. Each Legion has their own dialect based off the original created by The Dawn Legion.
TOOLTIPS.eldren: Eldren. The Ancient language of the civilization that came before in the universe. Hard to master.
TOOLTIPS.metron: A language of trade and contracts, clipped and rapid
TOOLTIPS.skelter: Fragmented and pidgin like language used amongst pirates, scavengers, and other fringe dwellers
TOOLTIPS.ferric: A near dead language used millennia ago to communicate with human-machine computers afte the Iron Tyranny
TOOLTIPS.syncra: Rhythmic and syncopated language. Used people who need to communicate without speaking - through tapping, banging and vibration

TRACKS.label: Label
TRACKS.requiredFields: Name and Track Groups are required fields.

WARNINGS.effectDeprecationBody: ActiveEffects will no longer be the preferred method of modifying Ship Ratings, starting in an upcoming release. You should remove any ActiveEffects from Ship Items and migrate your Rating modifiers to the new Rating Modifiers tab.

showBurnTooltip.label: Burn Tooltup
showBurnTooltip.hint: Show the Track Burn tooltip on hover.

showAttributeTooltip.label: Attribute Tooltup
showAttributeTooltip.hint: Show the Attribute tooltip on hover.

showDepth.label: Show Depth
showDepth.hint: Display the Depth rating on Ship sheets. Requires reload.

trackPosition.label: Track Position
trackPosition.hint: Where to display the UI Track Panel. Requires reload.
